hi and welcome you listening to the

outlook is getting darker and darker
let's get into the economic collapse

system they do not want cryptocurrency
they're trying to push people away from

full control over cryptocurrency by

government say this is the coin you need

cryptocurrency where it's outside of

they're making it seem very volatile
they're hacking exchanges now you have
to remember the exchange is not Bitcoin
the exchange is not a theory in the
exchange is not any of the
cryptocurrencies this is where you can
trade cryptocurrency you can store them
in wallets and it is a centralized
location just like the banking system I
mean if you look at the banking system
we've seen hacks into the banking system
because it's a centralized system this
is why the next generation of the
blockchain system we're going to see
decentralized exchanges because we could
see with centralized exchanges they can
be hacked now are they hacking the
blockchain no they are not they're
hacking the actual exchanges where
everything comes together and it's
centralized and this is very important
now over the weekend 42 billion was
wiped off the cryptocurrency market and
this is over a small North Korean
exchange hack this is coin Rail
announced that their hack via their
website calling it system maintenance
and it's still down it says system
system maintenance on there and
basically the small Korean exchange
stated that these hackers stole up to
about 30 percent of the digital tokens
in its storage coin rail confirmed that
the remaining 70% had been safely moved
to a cold wallet and remained unharmed
and we see right now that this is a
centralized system right here and this
is why in the future it will not be like
this because right now the banking

all the hacks that have been happening
at the banking level because everything

comparison the top two cryptocurrency

roughly about 1.7 billion traded on each
of their exchanges add a coin rail is
only the 98th largest crypto exchange so
it's really not that big and of course
the hack is bringing up major red flags
and people are saying oh my god I better

Street Journal's out there saying
because of the hack it looks like the

it's the exchange where everything comes
centralized to one location and
eventually what's going to happen in

if we look back in time we can see every

credit impulse gauge declines we see a
credit crisis now we saw this back in
2008 and
seeing it today as the credit impulse
continually declines and basically
what's going to happen is that it's
everything's gonna start to slow up
everything's gonna come to a screeching
halt everything's going to freeze and
the entire system is going to be in

Bernanke is out there and he's saying

where he said I don't see a recession
we're not forecasting recession there's

we had the recession later in 2008 when
he told us in 2008 we weren't going to
see a recession so if we go back in time
a little bit
Bernanke saw no risk to the economy when
there was 13 trillion dollars in deficit
four point seven trillion fed QE bubble
1.5 trillion increase in taxes
stagnating real wages productivity
growth and labor participation rate at
17 1978 levels but he's worried about
that tax cuts right now everything else
he didn't see a problem the biggest

these central bankers are really saying
is that their system is not going to

they say the whole thing's gonna fall

they're talking about what's going to

they don't want their system to implode
I mean look at Argentina right now they

again because you cannot fix the problem

is in
freefall which means either they have to

a complete and utter disaster
and again they the central bankers they

everyone would point the finger at the

so they're very careful on what they do
and this is why they need to make sure
every time they give more and more debt
this is why they need to have the
government's and they're forcing the
government's to push austerity on the

and we see that things did not go well
in the g7 and it looks like the EU

and we see right now they're trying to

now is that we have the deep state the

happening is the old central banking
system the way they had it is being
pushed out and they don't like it they
don't know what to do and this is why
Christine Lagarde is out there and she
is the head of the International
Monetary Fund and she's pointing out
that there's a problem with the global
economic outlook and it's darkening
day by day she's saying that trumps
America first trade policy well it looks
like it's having a terrible effect on

rolling in it's getting darker and
darker and it's not going to work
for the global economy if we continue on

thinly veiled attack on Trump's trade

business confidence which had soured
even since the weekend g7 summit the
washington-based IMF is sticking to its

percent and you know the IMF is always
off in their forecasts the hill ways say
oh it's gonna be around 4% and they say
it's gonna be around 3.5% then they come

and over and over and if you look back

continuously there they're never right

be and she went on to say that the
clouds are on the horizon and we are now

darker by the day and the biggest and
darkest cloud that we see is the
deterioration in confidence that is
prompted by an attempt to challenge the
way in which trade has been conducted in
which relationships have been handled
and in which multi multilateral
organizations have been operating
basically what she's saying is you are
questioning the way the central banking
system has run over many many years and
we don't like this because now you are

they're pushing against the central

this is their main push in the end

this is what the end game looks like
when the central banking system is

they're propping up the stock market
they manipulate all the numbers and they

they don't know what to do at this point
because that's what they normally have
and every time they try to push that

thought they were going to have a

where they would have this event and

everything's all said and done they
reekin think when we start the system
because no one will remember what

there's a problem there's no war and

this is their problem because their
